title-group.article-title: Optimistic Capital Budgeting Forecasts: An Experiment

abstract.p: Post-audits generally reveal that actual project costs exceed their forecasts, and actual project revenues fall short of their forecasts. Do decision makers believe that forecasts submitted to them are optimistically biased? Do they adjust forecasts submitted to them to correct for this perceived bias? Our research supports an affirmative answer to both questions. We also found that, the more work experience a decision maker has, the more likely he or she is to believe that forecasts are optimistically biased.
